commit 96a7efe4e1a81dcd787f6784937d3b7a506a7972
Author: Bysa Boro <baysaa@gmail.com>
Date:   Thu Dec 10 18:40:54 2020 +0000

    Fix error when resolving the entity on entity.node.revision route
    
    When an entity's render array has 'og_membership_state' cache
    context, then OG's route resolvers error out when viewing that
    node's earlier revisions on the entity.node.revision route.
    
    This happens because $route->getParameter('node') returns a string
    ID of the entity instead of the fully loaded entity.

Date:   Tue Sep 22 22:07:10 2020 +0100

    Add 'auto_add_owners' setting
    
    * When the setting is ON (default) membership is created
      automatically for group owners/creators.
    * When the setting is OFF membership is not created automatically
      for group owners/creators.
    
    Changelist:
    
    * Added config schema changes
    * Added default installation config changes
    * Added update hook to update existing configurations
    * Added the setting in the AdminSettingsForm
    * Updated og_entity_insert to be aware of the new config setting
    * Updated tests

commit e27ef9980ef6ec7526eefef4f88130229115de0c
Author: Pieter Frenssen <pieter@frenssen.be>
Date:   Wed Jul 29 17:02:38 2020 +0300

    Split up ::userAccessEntity() in two methods.
    
    This method was previously handling both user permissions and entity operations
    but this was confusing and problematic. It is now split into two separate
    methods with a clear scope: one is handling user permissions and the other
    handles entity operations.

Date:   Wed Jul 24 21:53:45 2019 +0300

    Field item lists take priority over raw values, so ensure to use them if they are populated.

commit 5b3b0caecae83375ae113254e2c7ab988db50a8c
Author: Pieter Frenssen <pieter@frenssen.be>
Date:   Wed Jul 24 19:18:09 2019 +0300

    When field values are set on a freshly created, unsaved, entity the value array will be empty but the field item list will be populated.

commit 138b8c559c0777a9da3d8edccb3a2e0581bff81d
Author: Pieter Frenssen <pieter@frenssen.be>
Date:   Wed Jul 24 18:09:03 2019 +0300

    Field values for single property fields can be stored in arrays.
    
    When a field value is populated on an entity from the database the property
    value is stored as a flat scalar value, while if the value is set through
    the field API the value is an array.
    
    See SqlContentEntityStorage::mapFromStorageRecords() vs
    FieldItemList::setValue().

commit b88b339ec54ab5467405f0fcaca6614c6750d583

    Do not yet enforce that the user ID should be an integer.
    
    The core entity API often returns the user ID as a string value even though it
    is defined as an integer in the base field definitions. Let's wait until core
    is more strict about returning the right data type.

commit 380756a7e61bacab53bc6437a242149d5d49084b
Merge: f0047168 52720584
Author: Pieter Frenssen <pieter@frenssen.be>
Date:   Fri May 17 17:03:28 2019 +0200

    Do not invalidate group content list cache tags when the group itself changes (#509)
    
    Do not invalidate group content list cache tags when the group itself changes

commit 52720584d4cb9e2b2dbf629555e8b5c09e5b5e07
Author: Pieter Frenssen <pieter@frenssen.be>
Date:   Tue May 14 17:44:50 2019 +0200

    Do not attempt to invalidate group content list cache tags if the group itself changes.
    
    If the group content list includes any data from the group itself then the
    list will be tagged with the group cache tags and will be invalidated
    automatically if the group is saved.

commit e5eff34d2ad4f31a56f43d92b4c749f7ea1f848a

    This also exposes an exception that was occurring when invalidating group
    content list cache tags when updating a group entity.

commit 528188f688cb739d46c4eab9f7beababa354aeef
Author: Pieter Frenssen <pieter@frenssen.be>
Date:   Sun May 12 14:07:46 2019 +0200

    Fix random failure in OgMembershipTest::testGetSetCreatedTime().
    
    CreatedItem::applyDefaultValue() is responsible for setting the created time
    on a newly created entity but still depends on the deprecated REQUEST_TIME
    constant. Switch back to this to avoid random failures when the time service
    is instantiated one second after the request time is set.

commit 5d4278d55b80b89b04bcfec7eb7e43bc3a023ec4
Author: Pieter Frenssen <pieter@frenssen.be>
Date:   Mon Apr 22 14:59:58 2019 +0200

    The `context` annotation has been deprecated in favor of `context_definitions` in Drupal 8.7.
    
    Ref. https://www.drupal.org/node/3016699
    
    This breaks backwards compatibility with Drupal 8.6 which does not yet support
    the `context_definitions` annotation.

commit 9d76e0c1fadb83d73bfceb812868d980c072ca6f
Author: Pieter Frenssen <pieter@frenssen.be>
Date:   Mon Apr 22 14:46:02 2019 +0200

    Trying to install invalid schemas for the System module has been deprecated in Drupal 8.7.
    
    Ref. https://www.drupal.org/node/3003360

commit 68cc7095294852689a5fecc99641a867b0f0ea86
Author: Pieter Frenssen <pieter@frenssen.be>
Date:   Mon Apr 22 13:40:18 2019 +0200

    Declare which properties are intended to be exported for membership types.
    
    This is required starting with Drupal 8.7.
    Ref. https://www.drupal.org/node/2949023

commit 2e74eddfa641eacfac8cf73611d4f821266fbad8
Author: Pieter Frenssen <pieter@frenssen.be>
Date:   Mon Apr 22 12:46:10 2019 +0200

commit 6302d0aa9ffe01d25379a1b72dff169eeab34158
Merge: 78c5313a 940b6c91
Author: Amitai Burstein <amitai@gizra.com>
Date:   Tue Jan 8 11:34:34 2019 +0200

    Merge pull request #458 from xurizaemon/8.x-1.x-existing_membership_exception
    
    Show uid in LogicException for existing membership

commit 940b6c915958a6f7b2aaf5e31abc14cb6f09f42e
Author: Chris Burgess <chris@giantrobot.co.nz>
Date:   Tue Jan 8 11:06:28 2019 +1300

    Show uid in LogicException for existing membership
    
    When using OG with migrations, the module can generate a series of import failures with exceptions that could be more useful.
    
        [error]  LogicException: An OG membership already exists for group of entity-type node and ID: 8553 in Drupal\og\Entity\OgMembership->preSave() (line 466 of /var/www/localhost/drupal/web/modules/contrib/og/src/Entity/OgMembership.php).
        [error]  An OG membership already exists for group of entity-type node and ID: 8553 (/var/www/localhost/drupal/web/core/lib/Drupal/Core/Entity/Sql/SqlContentEntityStorage.php:783)
        [error]  LogicException: An OG membership already exists for group of entity-type node and ID: 11100 in Drupal\og\Entity\OgMembership->preSave() (line 466 of /var/www/localhost/drupal/web/modules/contrib/og/src/Entity/OgMembership.php).
        [error]  An OG membership already exists for group of entity-type node and ID: 11100 (/var/www/localhost/drupal/web/core/lib/Drupal/Core/Entity/Sql/SqlContentEntityStorage.php:783)
        [error]  LogicException: An OG membership already exists for group of entity-type node and ID: 11113 in Drupal\og\Entity\OgMembership->preSave() (line 466 of /var/www/localhost/drupal/web/modules/contrib/og/src/Entity/OgMembership.php).
        [error]  An OG membership already exists for group of entity-type node and ID: 11113 (/var/www/localhost/drupal/web/core/lib/Drupal/Core/Entity/Sql/SqlContentEntityStorage.php:783)
    
    Including the uid in these exceptions will make the reported error more actionable; that information probably would be implicit when the exception is surfaced through a subscribe UI but is not apparent when migrating thousands of user memberships.

    types, with the same role name.

commit 4237fcd7f9b64e09f32329d0c70c9643d99b7114
Author: moshe weitzman <weitzman@cyrve.com>
Date:   Thu Aug 2 18:18:19 2007 +0000

    major enhancements to views integration. 'posts in specified group' filter and the analogous argument now accept strings like 3,4,7 and 3+4+7. like taxonomy urls, this elects posts that are in all those groups are any of those groups. also added a filter and an argument which accept substrings on group titles so you can see all nodes belonging to groups with the word 'marketing' in them. this fulfills some of the needs for subgroups.

commit 8b179ddd7bc84fa385b6e275fe53883e1af5bc17
Author: moshe weitzman <weitzman@cyrve.com>
Date:   Tue Jul 3 00:20:44 2007 +0000

    a few unrelated changes. sorry - i was offline and unable to commit as i went.
    
    defer sending of notification emails until cron time. this speeds up posting for big groups with lots of email subscribers. the job_queue module is required for this feature. if not present, notifications are sent in real time (just like before this change).
    
    remove 'website' as a field for groups. in order to get this back, add 'website' to your node type(s) that behave as groups. i left the website field in the og table. sites that want to preserve this data need to migrate it to their new field.
    
    added an og_requirements() which gently warns if og access control is disabled and if job_queue.module is disabled.

Date:   Mon Mar 27 05:49:00 2006 +0000

    added one update from long ago. the query to avoid this initial set of updates has now changed slightly. it is (add your prefix if needed): UPDATE system SET schema_version=6 WHERE name='og' AND type='module';

commit eb62bc9b049b6e7da5af7121d3320ba451894175
Author: moshe weitzman <weitzman@cyrve.com>
Date:   Mon Mar 27 05:14:04 2006 +0000

    use the update system provided by core instead of custom script. sites that currently run og on HEAD or 4.7 should immediately set their system table so that these updates are not run (since you likely already have these updates). to do so, run this query: UPDATE system SET schema_version=5 WHERE name='og' AND type='module';. After running that query, only future updates will show up on your update.php page

    user warning: Column 'nid' in field list is ambiguous query: SELECT nid,
    n.title, r.body, n.uid, u.name, og.description FROM og og INNER JOIN node n
    ON og.nid = n.nid INNER JOIN node_revisions r ON r.vid = n.vid INNER JOIN
    users u ON n.uid = u.uid WHERE og.directory=1 AND n.status=1 ORDER BY n.nid
    DESC LIMIT 0, 50 in /var/www/surf/includes/database.mysql.inc on line 108.

commit 81013a754a881c0103f9eda20cdc80fc1c5adbbf
Author: moshe weitzman <weitzman@cyrve.com>
Date:   Mon Jun 27 22:20:01 2005 +0000

    - added a 'new groups' block. this block and the subscribers block are now configurable as to the max number of items that they display.
    - added 'my groups' block
    
    each group may now decide if it wants to be listed on the 'list of groups' page and block. this commit added the 'directory' column to the og table. you will need to re-save your groups or run a SQL statement to set this field to 0 if you want hidden groups. a byproduct of this change is that all group home pages are now accessible (as they once were). The content on those pages is shown/hidden according to your 'visibility' settings. once again, you might want to re-save existing groups which were INVITE ONLY. that will make their home pages accessible to non-subscribers.
    
    changed 'register' field to a checkbox on aadmin/settings/og page
    
    fix: groups which don't choose otherwise follow any change in site default theme

commit 8d3b19887d502ef8c0f06892cf18c8aec84a5ca9
Author: moshe weitzman <weitzman@cyrve.com>

commit 76718bc03feea5321856cfd6abab95cf081796a9
Author: moshe weitzman <weitzman@cyrve.com>
Date:   Tue Nov 23 01:05:28 2004 +0000

    initial version. from the readme:
    
    Enable users to create and manage their own 'groups'. Each group can have subscribers, and maintains a a group page where subscribers can post into. groups may be selective or not. Selective groups require approval in order to become a member.
    
    Makes heavy use of the new node access API
